replies.body:
Potential. SO this yasuo potential, is the reworked aimed at making yasuo easier to play? because currently 95% of them do nothing but feed.

I thought you likes playing yasuo anyway.
As said in the video he is indeed fun to play but I still acknowledge some fairness in League
There is plenty of fair, the only "issue" with yasuo is that instead of actually learning his mass amount of weaknesses people just complain instead.
Looks like yi is finally gonna need some skill xD
I mean yi is easy as fuck to deal with...  skilled or otherwise.

Why does riot always preoccupy themselves with champions they know people like?  Yasuo, Yi, Kalista, Lee, etc, all snowball well in the right hands and have relatively fine early games, but this stays consistent with many other champions. 

Nerfing relatively balanced yet popular champions is never smart, if they are popular people will become more experienced in the art of counterplay and while these fun champions are nerfed the 'sleeper OPs' will simply supersede them. 

Think Diana, Darius, Volibear, Ryze.

Slightly off topic, but Riot is also quite stupid when it comes to item changes and champion reworks. 
For example, they metamorphised Gragas from an AP burster to an AP bruiser with the justification that it is more fitting for an ugly corpulent drunkard  to be more tanky than damage based. 

In terms of item changes, Riot is quite stupid in that they nerfed ryalais with the justification that it should not be a key item for APs which do not have DOT effects, I suppose they should extend that logic and nerf death cap so it better synergises with champions which 100-0 rather than play the war of attrition (Ziggs), oh wait they did play that game of creating specific items per champion but then they removed DFG.

When will Riot gain even a modicum of sanity in the game changes they implement?
